title: Women's Opinions about their Doctors
question_text:
A polling organization randomly sampled $1{,}287\text{ female U.S. residents}$ between the ages of 40 and 60 to ask them if they agreed with the statement, "My doctor does a good job of listening to my concerns."
The population of interest for this study was all American

choices.text: Citizens between the ages of 40 and 60.
Women between the ages of 40 and 60.
Doctors who treat women between the ages of 40 and 60.

solution:
The sample was made of only women in the U.S. between the ages of 40 and 60. Since samples are chosen to represent the population, the population of interest must also have these characteristics.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect. This is inclusive of males and females, while the sample was only taken of females.

Choice 'B' is incorrect. This is inclusive of all ages of American females.

Choices 'D' and 'E' are incorrect. While the underlying motive of the study may be to study doctors, the survey itself is interested in the opinions of women aged 40 to 60.
